Key Match Events: Bradley Barcola found the net in the opening minute
Italy levelled after half an hour with Federico Dimarco volleying home a deft back-heel flicked pass from Sandro Tonali
Davide Frattesi put Italy ahead five minutes after the interval
Giacomo Raspadori gave the visitors the breathing space they needed in the 74th minute
Post-Match Reflections: Italy manager Luciano Spalletti told RAI that 'Magnificent game. We were afraid that he (Tonali) wouldn't make it to play 90 minutes, but in the end he gave two good bursts. We found a very strong player again.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Italy came from behind to stun France in 3-1 win
The game was a highly-entertaining Nations League A Group 2 opening game
Both sides came into the game looking for redemption after failing to impress at Euro 2024
